column1: 9271,"[:en]How to get long-term Vietnam visa for foreigners ?[:]","[:en]

column2: The long-term Vietnam visa for foreigners working in Vietnam is valid from 3 months to 1 year at maximum. This type of  visa for foreigners is common symbolized as LĐ, ĐT.
1. The legal basis for getting long term Vietnam visa for foreigners
- According to the Rule No 47/2014/QH2013 of the Law on Entry, exit, transit and residence of foreigners in Vietnam
- The Circular No 04/2015/tt-BCA of the visa application form, temporary visas for foreigners
2. Documents for getting long-term Vietnam visa for foreigners

- The work permit for enterprises, organizations (Business registration, Investment permit, work permit of branch, representative etc. Enterprises, organizations have to submit these things for the first time at the Immigration Office)
- Seal specimen registration certificate or notification of seal samples from the enterprises and organizations.

- Registration for seal samples and signature of the authorized person of the organization (NA16). (Handle this application in the situation that the company first submits the document at the Immigration Department)
- Application form for visa issuance, stay extension for temporary residence foreigners in Vietnam (NA5)
- Original passport with its validity (6 months at minimum dated from expired long-term visa date is about to get another one)

- Work permit or work permit exemption for situations for those who are exempted for work permit or documents proving the capital contribution to foreigners who are investors. according to the regulations of Enterprise Law and Investment Law.
- Temporary residence book or certificate of temporary residence for foreigners
3. Submit the document at the Immigration Office

At Vietnam, enterprises who submit the documents for granting long term visa for foreigners make the documents at the Immigration Office of province or central city public security where the enterprises, organizations set up the headquarter.
4. Processing time for long-term Vietnam visa

Time for this procedure takes 05 working days since the approved application submission. Time for getting result is written down clearly in the receipts when the enterprises, organizations submit the documents at the department of one Immigration Office.

To make the application form for visa issuance, stay extension for temporary residence foreigners in Vietnam, or for further information relating to long-term Vietnam visa, please contact  us at support@vietnamvisavoa.com to receive the best consulting for any particular situation.
Source: xuatnhapcanh.com.vn

If you need more information about long-term Vietnam visa, or needs any consultancy about Vietnam visa on arrival, please do not hesitate to contact us via support@vietnamvisavoa.com or hotline: +84.94 127 92 89.

Vietnam visa for foreign investors is symbolized as ĐT and it is valid for 01 year at maximum. It is used for foreign investors, who set up or combine capital for the company performance in Vietnam, are granted Vietnam visa or the temporary residence card for long term business in Vietnam.
In the situation that the investors want to stay longer in Vietnam, they can ask for temporary residence card with no more than 5 years.
The procedures to get Vietnam visa for foreign investors
I. The legal basis of visa issuance for foreign investors
- According to the Law No.47/2014/QH2013 of the Law on Entry, exit, transit and residence of foreigners in Vietnam
- The Circular No 04/2015/TT--BCA for the documents relating to Entry, exit, residence of foreigners in Vietnam
II. The documents for getting Vietnam visa for foreign investors
1. The certified copy of Business permit/ Investment permit
2. Seal specimen registration certificate or notification of seal samples from the enterprises on the national business registration portal.
3. The specimen No NA16: registration for the seal samples and signature of the legal representative of the enterprises organizing the business in Vietnam

Note: If the enterprises, organizations have submitted the documents in Section 2,3 once, they do not need to submit above documents for the following times when making the procedures at the Immigration Office.
4. The specimen NA5: Application form for visa issuance, stay extension for temporary residence foreigners in Vietnam
5. The valid original passport as required
6. Temporary residence registration as required
III. Submitting the documents for visa issuance for foreign investors
Enterprises can submit at the Immigration Office of province or central city public security where the enterprises set up the main headquarter.
IV. Processing time for getting Vietnam visa for foreigners
According to the regulation, it takes 05 working days since the day enterprises submit all the required documents as required.
For the specimen form, and any questions about Vietnam visa for foreign investors, please contact us via support@vietnamvisavoa.com/ +84941279289  for best consulting.

column1: 9282,"[:en]How to apply for work permit in Vietnam?[:]","[:en]

column2: In order to work in Vietnam legally, you must apply for a work permit. Work permit in Vietnam is issued by Vietnam Department of Labor, Invalid and Society. It is valid for a period of 36 months. After it is expired, foreigners have to reapply for a renewal permit. Want to know about the requirement and procedure for work permit application ? This article is for you!
The requirements for getting work permit in Vietnam.
- Expats must be from 18 years old upwards and have good  health condition for the demand of the job.

- Expats applying for local companies must be either managers or executives, or must have an area of technical expertise, that the domestic labors cannot currently conduct efficiently in the Vietnam labor market.

- Expats must not have a criminal record for infringement of national security, must not be facing examination of penal liability and must not be serving a criminal penalty as prescribed by Vietnamese or foreign law.
How to apply for work permit in Vietnam ?
The process of applying a work permit for foreigners in Vietnam includes 2 main steps:
Step 1: Completing the application form and submitting it at the municipal office of Department of Labor, Invalid and Society.
The list of things are:
- Work permit application form
- Work permission application letter
- Criminal record issued by the authority of the resident country or the municipal office of Justice in Vietnam if they live in Vietnam for more than 6 months
-  A copy of your certificate or degree
- Health check from a qualified hospital for at least 6 months validity
- Curriculum vitae with passport photo
- 3 color photos (3x4cm) that have been taken within 1 year
Step 2: Collecting the work permit
After receiving above papers, the labor and social welfare service of the province/city will inform if they approve your work permit application or any changes needed within 15 days.
Fee: It varies with three major levels
Official fee will be as below but you may expect to pay for service fee when you get the service from travel agencies/ travel consultants.
- For new applicants: 400,000VND($20USD)
- For re-issued work permits: 300,000VND ($15USD)
- For renewal work permits: 200,000VND ($10USD)
Exemption for work permit in Vietnam:
-  Working in Vietnam for less than 3 months
- In a company’s board of the corporation that is created under the regulation of the Vietnamese government
- Head of the representative office or branch of an international company in Vietnam
- Entering and working in Vietnam to resolve the emergent errors or situation that the Vietnamese labors or current foreign workers in Vietnam cannot solve.
- Lawyers that are given permission by the Vietnamese Department of Justice.
For further information about work permit in Vietnam, please contact us at: support@vietnamvisavoa.com or hotline: +84.94 127 92 89.

There are two ways of categorizing Vietnam visa types:
- Intended length of stay
- The purpose of the visit

If it is based on intended length of stay, there are 4 types of Vietnam visa: One-month single entry Vietnam visa, one-month multiple entry Vietnam visa, three-month single entry Vietnam visa and three-month multiple entry visa.
If it is based on the purpose of the visit, Vietnam visa is divided into many types with different symbols of Vietnam visa types.
Belows are symbols of Vietnam visa types categorized in the purpose of visit for foreigners who want to apply for Vietnam visa should equip themselves in order to avoid unnecessary complications.
Application form for Vietnam visa on arrival. vietnamvisavoa.com
1. SQ visa: issued for one-month single and multiple entry visa
2. HN, DL visa: issued for three-month single and multiple entry visa
3. VR visa: issued for not over 6 months
4. NG1, NG2, NG3, NG4, LV1, LV2, DN, NN1, NN2, NN3, DH, PV1, PV2 and TT visa: issued for not over 12 months.

According to the provisions at Article 8 of the Law on entry, exit, transit and residence of foreigners in Vietnam of 47/2014 /QH2013 issued June 16, 2014 and takes effect from 01 May 01 2015, new regulations about symbols of Vietnam visa for foreigners entering Vietnam are defined as follows:
1. NG1 - Issued to members of delegations invited by the Secretary General of Vietnam’s Communist Party of, the President of Vietnam, the President of the National Assembly, the Prime Minister.

2. NG2 - issued to members of delegations invited by standing members of the Secretariat of the Vietnam’s Communist Party, Deputy President of Vietnam, Deputy President of the National Assembly, Deputy Prime Minister, President of Vietnamese Fatherland Front, Executive Judge of The Supreme Court, Chief Procurator of the Supreme Procuracy, State Auditor General; members of delegations at the same levels of Ministers, Secretary Generals of Provincial Communist Authorities, President of the People’s Committees of provinces.

3. NG3 - Issued to members of diplomatic missions, consular offices, representative offices of international organizations affiliated to the UN, representative offices of intergovernmental organizations and their spouses, children under 18 years of age, and housemaids during their term of office.

4. NG4- Issued to people who come to work with diplomatic missions, consular offices, representative offices of international organizations affiliated to the UN, representative offices of intergovernmental organizations, visitors of members of diplomatic missions, consular offices, representative offices of international organizations affiliated to the UN, and representative offices of intergovernmental organizations.

5. LV1 - Issued to people who come to work with units affiliated to Vietnam’s Communist Party; the National Assembly, the government, Central Committee of Vietnamese Fatherland Front, the People’s Supreme Court, the People’s Supreme Procuracy, State Audit Agency, Ministries, ministerial agencies, Governmental agencies, the People’s Councils, the People’s Committees of provinces.
6. LV2 - Issued to people who come to work with socio-political organizations, social organizations, Vietnam Chamber of Commerce and Industry.
7. ĐT - Issued to foreign investors in Vietnam and foreign lawyers practicing in Vietnam.
8. DN - Issued to people who come to work with companies in Vietnam.
9. NN1 - Issued to Managers of representative offices or projects of international organizations and foreign non-governmental organizations in Vietnam.
10. NN2 - Issued to heads of representative offices, branches of foreign traders, representative offices of other foreign economic, cultural, professional organizations in Vietnam.

11. NN3 - Issued to people who come to work with foreign non-governmental organizations, representative offices, branches of foreign traders, representative offices of other foreign economic, cultural, professional organizations in Vietnam.

12. DH - Issued to people who come to study or serve internship. Before entering Vietnam, applicants have to get a visa DH approval letter which is granted by the Immigration Department. With this approval letter, applicants can get visa stamped at overseas visa-issuing authority of Vietnam (Vietnam Embassy, Vietnam General Representative… or border checkpoint like Moc Bai border gate, international airports) in special case.
13. HN - Issued to people who come to attend conventions or conferences.
14. PV1 - Issued to journalists who have permanent residences in Vietnam.
15. PV2 - Issued to journalists who come to work for a short period of time in Vietnam.
16. LĐ - Issued to people who come to work.
17. DL - Issued to tourists.

18. TT - Issued to foreigners that are parents, spouse, and children under 18 years of age of the foreigners issued with LV1, LV2, ĐT, NN1, NN2, UNIVERSITY, PV1, LĐ visas, or foreigners that are parents, spouse, and children of Vietnamese citizens.
19. VR - Issued to people who come to visit their relatives or for have other purposes.
20. SQ - Issued to people in the cases mentioned in Clause 3 Article 17 of this Law.

If you need more information about symbols of Vietnam visa types, or needs any consultancy about Vietnam visa on arrival, please do not hesitate to contact us via support@vietnamvisavoa.com or hotline: +84.94 127 92 89.
Source: Vietnam Immigration Department.
Have you ever wondered why so many tourists choose Vietnam for their destination? And the answer agrees on most of tourists is due to Vietnamese street food.

Vietnamese street food is foods that you will try on the street food stalls. You might think of food on a stick or in a roll, something that is convenient to carry and eat. Or you might think street food seems to be unappealing as it is usually cooked outside or in little shacks. However, when you taste them, you might think again and you could understand why Vietnamese foods appeal not only for locals but also for tourists alike. One clear illustration is that we have so many food stalls in almost  every streets of Vietnam. As a result, you might understand that because Vietnamese foods are so delicious and Vietnamese cam eat all the time until midnight. And do you think that Vietnamese foods are healthy or not ? Yes, it is. It must be thanks to the sensitive taste for foods and the healthy herbs and vegetables that we could mix with other ingredients. Here is the list of 5 famous foods that are most delicious and popular for local as well as tourists’ taste.
1. Nem/Vietnamese spring roll

This is very yummy and creative dish that is wrapped with flavorful herbs and fresh veggies and meat inside a spring roll. It has full nutrients and healthier raw versions found as well as the deep fired ones. It is definitely a must eat on the street and is a Vietnamese signature dish and is made worldwide.
2. Pho

Vietnamese traditional noodles soup, meat and fresh herbs, veggies and chili. The great thing is that you might compile the flavors yourself. The broth is superb and it is the thing that makes the brand name of Vietnamese food. Added to the broth is meat like beef, chicken, fish and is various of fresh herbs such as basil, coriander, lettuce, green onion. The taste is better when adding some chili sauce, lime or kumquat fruit, flavor with soy sauce or fish sauce.
3. Banh mi/bread

This is probably one of the most famous tourist attractions in Vietnam. The interesting thing of banh mi is that the warm crusty bread is filled with veggies, pickles, pork ham and liver paste. It is absolutely delicious. There are thousands of vendors spreading pate on a bun and filling it with cold cuts and veggies in everywhere. It is super convenient to enjoy it all the time and can take it away.
4. Xoi/Sticky rice

It seems to be great breakfast that can be suitable for both sweet and salty flavors. The glutinous rice can be at the bottom with a number of ingredients for flavor including mung bean, fired shallots, chicken, minced pork with dried green onion on top and sugar for the sweet version.
5. Nom du du/Papaya salad

This is one of the most popular salads for young Vietnamese people. It is made from shreds of papaya in a sweet and sour spicy sauce, topped with braised beef liver or lung. It is very interesting and are favored that most people can have it every day.
To enjoy Vietnamese street food, let apply for Vietnam visa on arrival via this online application form!

Are you looking for the procedure to get married a Vietnamese citizen ? Any foreigner can get married in Vietnam as long as they are living in Vietnam and meet these conditions:
-The woman is over 18 and the man is over 20
-Neither the man nor the woman has a spouse under Vietnamese law
-Both partners are mentally capable of making independent decisions
-The couple does not have blood relatives in three generations
The following people are not allowed to get married in Vietnam:
-Adoptive parents and adopted children, stepfather and daughter-in-law, stepmother and son-in-law, stepfather and his wife’s daughter, stepmother and her husband’s son
-Same-sex couples
Necessary documents for marriage registration in Vietnam
-A completed marriage application form in Vietnam: your photo, your personal information, your signature.

- Proof of marital status – an applicant must prove their single or divorced status, or that their spouse is deceased, with a document issued by a competent agency from their home country. This document must be dated no earlier than six months before the date when the marriage documents are submitted

- Medical certificate – this can be issued by a competent organisation in Vietnam or abroad and must be dated no earlier than six months before the date when the marriage document is submitted. It must certify that the applicants are not suffering from a mental illness or any other illness that impedes independent decision making
- Certified copy of personal identity for Vietnamese citizens
- Certified copy of household registration certificates or resident registration for Vietnamese citizens
- Passport or resident card – foreigners and Vietnamese citizens residing abroad
- Temporary/Permanent resident card – foreigners residing in Vietnam
- Application fee

Note: Two copies in Vietnamese of all marriage application documents are needed. They must then be submitted by only one or both intended bride or groom to the Department of Justice in the area of residence.
Department of Justice
The Department of Justice carries out the following responsibilities in the run up to your civil marriage:

Applicant Interview – this is to make sure both applicants are both entering into marriage voluntary and assess their meaning of their relationship. The interview will be officially recorded in full and both parties must sign the completed document.

Displaying of Banns – The couple’s marriage banns will be officially displayed at the People's Committee of Communes in the applicants’ place of residence. They will be displayed for seven consecutive days – This time is for any party to announce that the couple may not be fit to marry. If this does occur it is up to the People's Committee of Communes in the applicants’ place of residence to inform the Department of Justice.
Decision - Within 25 working days after receiving the documents and fee the Department of Justice issues its decision.
Civil Marriage - Once the marriage certificate has been signed by the Head of the Provincial People’s Committee, the Department of Justice will arrange a civil marriage within five working days.

column1: 9344,"[:en]Everything you need to know about visa to Phu Quoc Island[:]","[:en]

column2: According to the newest decision from Vietnam Government, travellers who visit Phu Quoc Island (Vietnam) for tourist purpose will be exempted from Vietnam visa upto 30 days . This decision took effect on 10 Mar, 2014.
In case foreigners who come to Vietnam by International gate (including road, air and sea), stay at transit area at the gate, and then forward to Phu Quoc Island is also exempted from Vietnam visa.
Visa to Phu Quoc
Requirements for getting visa exemption to Phu Quoc Island:
<li>

column4: Your passport must be valid for more than 6 months.

column2: <li>

column4: You must have a round trip air ticket to and from Phu Quoc. The onward destination after Phu Quoc can be any other destinations except Vietnam. Flights can be either direct to Phu Quoc or transit through one of other Vietnam international airports providing that the final destination is Phu Quoc. (updated as per December 24, 2015).

column2: <li>

column4: Your  stay in Phu Quoc island must be less than 30 days.

column2: Visa exemption to Phu Quoc Island
Since November, 2014, foreigners who fly directly to Phu Quoc island (via Siem Reap, Singapore etc) no longer requires visa.

Citizens of Thailand, Philippines, Malaysia, Brunei, Singapore, Indonesia and Laos holding valid ordinary passports are exempt from visa requirements and are allowed to stay for not more than 30 days.

Citizens of Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Finland, Japan and South Korea holding different kinds of passports are exempt from visa requirements and are allowed to stay for not more than 15 days for each entry. However, once nationals from these countries have left Vietnam, they have to wait 30 days in order to re-enter the country to be eligible again for the 15 day Visa exemption.

For those countries that are not in these lists above must obtain Vietnam visa prior to entry into Vietnam. It is recommended to apply for Vietnam visa on arrival at vietnamvisavoa.com. You just need to apply for visa online to get the visa approval letter online. Afterward, you take along with you the document to Vietnam International airports and get stamped visa done there simply.
Visa extensions in Phu Quoc Island

If you are in Phu Quoc island and need to extend your stay, you must extend your Vietnam visa, vietnamvisavoa.com will do this for you for a fee and the process will take about 12 business days. The process takes a long time because your passport needs to be taken to Ho Chi Minh city in order to get visa extended.
For further information, feel free to contact us at support@vietnamvisavoa.com or hotline
+84941279289 for utmost assistance.

column1: 9354,"[:en] Visa on arrival procedure at Vietnam International airports[:]","[:en]

column2: Vietnam visa on arrival cannot be used at any land/sea border crossing. The applicants must apply for a visa application form online to get a copy of Vietnam visa approval letter and arrive at Vietnam international airports: Ho Chi Minh, Hanoi, Da Nang and Nha Trang to collect stamped visa.

After getting the visa approval letter online, applicants have to print it out and bring along to the one of mentioned Vietnamese international airports to get your visa stamped. It is important that you get stamping fee in cash with you as Vietnam Immigration Department does not accept credit or debit cards. The stamping fee are recommended tobe USD dollar or Vietnam Dong. If you pay by other currencies, you may expect to wait for long for money exchange and get a low exchange rate.

Recently an ATM has been installed at Tan Son Nhat Airport (HCMC) adjacent to the landing visa counter. While this might be  a great help to those arriving without cash, it is still advisable to bring the required amount in cash.  ATMs do break down or run out of cash and the inevitable lack of clarity regarding the dong/ US dollar exchange rate applied at the landing visa counter (the ATM issues dong), plus additional card charges, means it should be thought of as the last solution.

At Ho Chi Minh City (Tan Son Nhat International Airport) the VOA window is situated at the far end on the left as you enter the immigration hall. Do not join any queues for Immigration Control. The counter itself is sign-posted - LANDING VISA.  When you get to the Landing Visa (VOA) window, be prepared to hand over your passport, ONE completed copy of Vietnamese visa application form, the entire letter of approval and ONE passport size photo (the officer will staple your photo to the form if not already attached). You should then leave and wait somewhere around. Even with few people being processed do not expect passports (with the visa attached) to be returned in the order that they were presented at the window.

When your visa is ready, your name will be called (do keep your ears open) and at the same time your passport held up to the window with the photo page showing. You then pay the stamping fee  - US 25 for single entry visa (one and three months); US 50 for multiple entry visas (one and three months). The notes should be in good condition (no marks, nicks or tears) but it is not necessary for them to be brand new. Once you have paid, your passport will be returned to you, along with a receipt for your payment. Be sure to check the newly issued visa for any errors while still at the window. You then go to Immigration control post to be processed in the normal way. Baggage claim and Customs are downstairs.

At Hanoi (Noi Bai International Airport) the VOA procedure has changed with the opening in January,2015 of the new International terminal. The VOA counter is situated opposite to the Immigration posts - the signage can be difficult to see if there are lots of people milling about. You must hand in your passport and documents at THE RIGHT-HAND SIDE. Then proceed to the left-hand side (or if busy, take a seat) to wait while your application is processed. There is large-screen display to the left of the counter, and when your visa is ready your passport photo, name and country will be shown and your name read out. At this point you pay for stamping fee in cash. If you are processing multiple passports you will receive one pink receipt for all of them. Your visa(s) will have been affixed to a page on your passport(s) and should be checked for errors while you are still at the counter. You can then proceed to the 'Foreigners' immigration queue. The entire process can take as little as 10 minutes or as much as an hour if there at lots of applicants and/or other flights have arrived at more or less the same time so the queues for immigration are long.

At Da Nang follow the exit signs. As soon as you enter the huge hall it is very easy to find the VOA window - it is on the left hand side and is clearly visible. The process is reasonably quick (approximately 15 minutes with all necessary paperwork completed before landing) but do bear in mind that there is no guarantee it will be always be the same. After receiving visas / passports back, progress onwards to Immigration control. Immigration Control can be slow, sometimes 3 or 4 long lines. Everyone queues up together going through the same check-points and there are no separate checkpoints for Vietnamese passengers and other nationalities.
Apply for visa on arrival Vietnam  by filling out this visa application form online now !
For further information about Vietnam visa on arrival procedures at Vietnam international airports, please contact us at support@vietnamvisavoa.com, we are willing to assist you.

column1: 9375,"[:en]Important notes for Vietnam visa application form[:]","[:en]

column2: Submitting the visa form online seems tobe simple, nevertheless, quite a lot of common mistakes that applicants make while filling out the Vietnam visa application form at vietnamvisavoa.com
1. Personal information

Many applicants fill in the application form with spelling mistakes: Full name, passport number or date of birth. It may not a big problem however, in some cases; they will be refused by the airline at the departure airport since the information on the letter of approval does not match with those in the passport. It is able to cause serious problems or lengthy delay at the Custom Office at arrival airport in Vietnam as well. Hence, each applicants need to make sure every information that they submit online is exactly the same as in the passport.
2. Visa validity

Some think that the visa validity will start from the date that they enter Vietnam, not from the date they provide. Practically, the visa validity will start from the date applicant provide in the registration form, not from the date they physically enter the country. As a result, each should make sure that it is a clear plan of when to enter before applying a Vietnam visa on arrival to Vietnam. It is important to note that applicant can enter Vietnam on a later date but not before that.
3. Getting Vietnam visa directly at Vietnam airport

Many people think that they can get visa directly at Vietnam airport without applying online as in other countries. However, it is totally wrong. You may end up with delaying, cancelling your flights or waiting at the airport until the visa is approved. Hence, it is a must to apply online for an approval letter in order to get on flight and then pick up your visa at Vietnam airport.
4. Visa on arrival applicability
Visa on arrival is applicable for air travel only. It means that there is no on arrival visa for overland or border crossing or sea/water entry.
5. Multiple entry visa

Multiple entry visa is interpreted as multiple entries, not multiple applicants. Multiple entry means you are allowed to enter / exit Vietnam multiple times within a given period of time (1 or 3 month(s)). For example: 3 month multiple entry visa means - you are allowed to enter / exit Vietnam as many times as you wish from the intended date of arrival you provided plus 3 calendar months. Multiple entry is highly recommended for those arriving at Vietnam, leaving the country to other countries and then coming back for flight home.
Single entry means tourists arrive and leave Vietnam only once. It is also more economical for the applicants.
6. Email address acuracy
The accuracy of email address in Vietnam visa application form is so important. It will affect on your receipt of visa approval letter. Hence, be careful when providing email address.
7. Processing time

The visa request is only processed when the payment for service fee is received and you will get visa approval letter via email within 1 working day for urgent service or 2 working days for normal service.
Let apply for Vietnam visa application form now and do not forget to contact us at support@vietnamvisavoa.com for further information or hotline: +84.94 127 92 89.
Apply online now!

column1: 9384,"[:en]How to pick up the visa at Vietnam international airports?[:]","[:en]

column2: After getting the approval letter printed, you need to take it along with you to Vietnam international airports. To get your visa stamped onto your passport, you need to pay stamping fee in cash in USD for Immigration office at Vietnam airport. For single entry visa (one month and three month single entry visa), it is $25USD and $50USD for multiple entry visa (one month and three month multiple entries). For less than six month multiple entries, it is $95USD/person and $135USD/person for 1 year visa.
At Tan Son Nhat airport (Ho Chi Minh city)

Vietnam visa on arrival counter is situated on the left as you enter the Immigration Hall. The visa on arrival office is signed ”Landing Visa”. You will come to this place first to submit your documents include your original passport, Vietnamese visa application form, Vietnam visa approval letter and stamping fee in cash to get the visa stamped on your passport.
At Noi Bai airport (Hanoi Airport)

The visa on arrival counter is situated opposite to the Passport Control.  However, the signage is not so clear if there are lots of people. After you submit documents to Visa landing office, you need to wait while they are doing their duty. If it is busy, please notice to the loudspeaker as they will call out your name or hold up your passport/photo and you will pay for the stamping fee here.

In case you get visa for a group of people, you will get one pink receipt for all, the visas will already be in the passports. Check the visas for errors while you are still there. After receiving your passports back, proceed to the “foreigners” passport control counter and get the stamp into your passport.
At Da Nang airport (Da Nang city)
At Da Nang International airport, as soon as you enter the huge Hall, it is very easy to find the Visa On Arrival window. It is on the left hand side and is eye-catching.

The process is quite fast (approximately within 15 minutes with all necessary paperwork completed before landing) but there is no guarantee to be the same. If you arrive when there are many tourists there, the process at Vietnam international airports might be slower. However, there is no problem when vietnamvisavoa.com offers tourist the fast track service. This service will help the travelers to get visa sticker quickly. It aims at assisting visitors at the airport when arriving with the highest satisfaction to avoid wasting their valuable time after the long flight or other personal circumstances. This services just takes 5-10 minutes and you can be at the luggage lounge to wait for your belonging. It is especially useful when you have limited time for your connecting flight or when you travel with infants or old people.

column1: 9397,"[:en]How to get Vietnam visa extension and renewal?[:]","[:en]

column2: This article shows you the difference between Vietnam visa extension and visa renewal and how to extend and renew a Vietnam visa.

Vietnamvisavoa.com is the travel agent in Hanoi, Vietnam and not only provides with Vietnam visa on arrival but also visa extension services for traveler and businessmen in Vietnam. Vietnam Visa Voa try to bring clients more useful information and assistance, visa extension or visa renewal services are offered for those whose Vietnam visas have come close to expiration dates and still wish to stay longer.
Extending Vietnam visa must be applied some days before your visa expired date. It takes 7 working days to finish as submitting your passport and requirement at Vietnam Immigration Department Office.
Vietnam visa extension:

It means that you will have new staying duration permission in Vietnam. Please remember that you are allowed to stay more in Vietnam without reentering if you exit Vietnam before your visa expired. It means you must apply new visa if you wish to come back Vietnam after leaving. So the extension fee is much cheaper than renewal fee.
In order to apply visa extension, your current visa has to meet some requirements of Vietnam Immigration Department.
Your current visa type has to be correspondent to your staying extending requirement.

- Stay in one more month: If your current visa is one month single, one month multiple, three month single or three month multiple entry visa, you are allowed to apply for visa extension in one more month.
- Stay in three more months: If your current visa is three month single or three month multiple entry visa, you can apply for visa extension in three more months.
Vietnam visa renewal:

It means that you are granted a new visa stamp and visa sticker on your passport with the new duration permission. The staying length is valid in three months at maximum. Moreover, the visa renewal fee is higher than the visa extension fee because we have to pay stamping fee and visa sticker fee for you. Visa renewal is ready for those who:
<li style=""text-align:justify"">

column4: Entered Vietnam with visa exemption

column2: <li style=""text-align:justify"">

column3: Has current visa is not correspondent to your staying extending requirement.

column2: If you would like to upgrade your current visa from 1 month to 3 month, you have to apply to renew three month single entry or three month multiple entry.
If you would like to upgrade your current visa from single entry to multiple entries, you have to apply to renew visa.
<li style=""text-align:justify"">

column3: Wish to get multiple entry visa in one month and three months.

column2: In order to apply your Vietnam visa extension or Vietnam visa renewal, please provide some necessary information as below to our email address support@vietnamvisavoa.com
<li style=""text-align:justify"">

column3: Passport scan

column2: <li style=""text-align:justify"">

column3: Current visa scan

column2: <li style=""text-align:justify"">

column3: Immigration stamp

column2: <li style=""text-align:justify"">

column3: Latest date of entry

column2: <li style=""text-align:justify"">

column3: Your current address in Vietnam

column2: We will inform what you have to do and how much you have to pay in detail because Vietnam visa can be extended or renewed as visa extension varies for each case.
After that you need to bring these following documents to our office:
<li style=""text-align:justify"">

column3: Your original passport

column2: <li style=""text-align:justify"">

column3: Temporary residence paper approved by the hotel where you live at or approved by local authorities where you live.

column2: <li style=""text-align:justify"">

column3: If you are Vietnamese overseas or your current visa is separate visa, you need to prepare two passport sized-photos 4x6cm with a straight forward face.

column2: Note: If you are in Ho Chi Minh city and Hanoi city, we can come in person to pick up your passport at your address on your request.
After some days, you can get your passport back together with your new stamped visa.
Important notes:
You had better extend or renew your Vietnam visa at least 1 week for 3 months visa, preferably 2 weeks before your visa is expired.
Before you apply for visa extension, your passport must have 2 blank pages at minimum.
For tourist and business visa, this visa extension or renewal is only applicable for one month or three months (single/multiple)
For diplomatic, official visas and other types of visa should be applied via the official agencies or government or business sponsor or contact the Vietnam immigration Department in person.

Are you preparing for your trip to Vietnam and you are searching for Vietnamese borders to enter ? International border gates to Vietnam are the places that all the activities take place on entry and exit gates, export, import, transit and border crossing for people and many different products.

Vietnam has two types of border crossings-international and local. International border gates to Vietnam are generally open to all foreign nationalities who are in possession of a valid passport and visa, while local crossings are open only to locals. Vietnam has over a dozen international overland border crossings. These borders allow overland travel to and from Cambodia, Laos and China. The most popular overland border crossing to Cambodia is the Bavet/Moc Bai crossing. To Laos, it is the Nam Phao/Cau Treo crossing. For China, you will pass through both the Dong Dang/ Ping Xian and Lao Cai/Hekou crossings, depending upon where in China you are headed.
International border gate to Vietnam from Cambodia
Le Thanh Border Gate: Located in Gia Lai Province (Central Highland Vietnam )
The Gate is about 73km from Pleiku City Vietnam. From Pleiku City along the highway 14, turn to highway 19, pass Chu Ty Townlet, across Le Thanh Border Gate to An Dong Thech (Ratanakiri, Cambodia).
Moc Bai Border Gate : Located in Tay Ninh Province ( Southern Vietnam)

Moc Bai Border Gate is about 70km to the northwest of Ho Chi Minh City. There are direct buses from Ho Chi Minh City to Go Dau Townlet in Tay Ninh Province and from here you can go along the highway 22A, across Moc Bai Border Gate to Cambodia.
Moc Bai: International border gate to VIetnam.
Sa Mat Border Gate: Located in Tay Ninh Province
This is another border gate to Cambodia from Tay Ninh province. Also from Go Dau you go along the highway 22B, across Sa Mat Border Gate to Cambodia.
Dinh Ba Border Gate: Located in Dong Thap Province (Southern Vietnam)

Dinh Ba Border Gate is about 107km from Cao Lanh City. From Cao Lanh City, you go along the highway 30 to Hong Ngu Townlet, across Sa Rai Townlet, Dinh Ba Border Gate to Bontia Chak Cray (Prey Veng, Cambodia).
Tinh Bien Border Gate: Located in An Giang Province (Southern Vietnam)

Tinh Bien Border Gate is about 25km to the southwest of Chau Doc Town, An Giang Province. From Long Xuyen City (An Giang Province) you can go along the highway 91, across Tinh Bien Border Gate to Cambodia.
Xa Xia Border Gate: Located in Kien Giang Province (Southern Vietnam)
The gate is about 70km from Ha Tien Town and it connects Kien Giang province of Vietnam toKampot province, Cambodia.
Vinh Xuong Border Gate: (By boat) Located in An Giang Province

Vinh Xuong Waterway Border Gate is 30km north of Chau Doc Town, An Giang Province. From the wharf at Victoria Chau Doc Hotel cruising on Tien River to Vinh Xuong Border Gate ( it takes about 45 minutes by motor-boat) then complete customs and immigration procedure to go to Phnom Penh, Cambodia.
International border gate to Vietnam from China
Lao Cai Border Gate: Located in Lao Cai Province – Northwest of Vietnam

Lao Cai Border Gate is in the north of Lao Cai City and about 45 km away from Sapa. The gate links Lao Cai Province (Vietnam) with Yunnan Province (China). Especially, there is arailway from here to Kunming, China.
Mong Cai Border Gate: Located in Quang Ninh Province – Northeast Vietnam

Mong Cai Border Gate is in the northeast of Quang Ninh Province, 176km away from Halong City and 327km from Hanoi. From Halong City, along the highway 18 to Mong Cai Town, and then across the Mong Cai Border Gate to China.
Huu Nghi Border Gate: Located in Lang Son Province
Huu Nghi Border Gate is 17km from Lang Son City centre, and it is 171km to northeast of Hanoi.
Dong Dang Border Gate: Located in Lang Son Province – Northeast Vietnam

Dong Dang is the most famous and busiest international border gate which connects Lang Son, Vietnam and Pingxang province, China. Especially, there is a railways from here to Nanning and Beijing, China.
International border gate to Vietnam from Laos
Tay Trang Border Gate: Located in Dien Bien Province – Northwest Vietnam
From Dien Bien Phu City you can ride motorbike on quiet road 279 about 33km to Tay Trang Border Gate and then to Phong Xa Ly District, Laos.
Na Meo Border Gate: Located in Thanh Hoa Province – Southwest to Hanoi.

The closest way to Na Meo border gate from Hanoi is about 270 Km and about 100 Km from Mai Chau valley. The gate connects Thanh Hoa province, Vietnam to Houaphan province, Laos. The road to the gate from Vietnamese side is quite rough but the scenery is beautiful.
Nam Can Border Gate: Located in Nghe An Province.
The gate connects Nghe An province, Vietnam to Xieng Khouang province, Laos in which there is a peaceful and green plateau.
Keo Nua Border Gate: Located in Ha Tinh Province
Keo Nua Border Gate is at the end of Keo Nua mountain Pass from Vietnamese side. This is a popular gate for tourists who want to travel to Vientiane (Laos) from Hanoi.
Lao Bao Border Gate: Located in Quang Tri Province ( Central Vietnam)

The gate is about 180 Km from Hue – the ancient capital of Vietnam. Getting up to the north from Hue then turn left to famous road No 9 via Khe Sanh and after the Lao Bao border gate you can head straight to Savannakhet (Laos).
Cha Lo Border Gate: Located in Quang Binh Province
From Vietnamese side, you can have easy ride on smooth road from Ba Don town ( Quang Binh province) to the gate. After the gate you will be in Khammounan province, Laos.
Po Y Border Gate: Located in Kon Tum Province ( Central highland of Vietnam )
At Vietnam side from Ngoc Hoi District you can ride along highway 40 about 19km to the gate and then head to Attapeu province, Laos.
For more information about international border gates to Vietnam, please contact us at support@vietnamvisavoa.com

If you are intending to travel by air to Vietnam, simply, you submit your visa request at: http://vietnamvisavoa.com/apply-online/ to get stamped visa on arrival. If you travel to Vietnam through borders above, you would need to arrange visa at Vietnam Embassy/ Consulate in any countries before heading to Vietnam.
Have a great time in our country!

column1: 9416,"[:en]Things to do when visiting Vietnam?[:]","[:en]

column2: What to do when visiting Vietnam? The question is first given when considering about choosing Vietnam. Here is the answer for things to do when visiting Vietnam.
1. Seeing breathtaking landscape

With the favorable weather conditions of nature, Vietnam is truly a hidden germ that just visiting Vietnam to experience. Vietnam is not short of World Heritage Site that were recognized by the UNESCO: Halong Bay, Phong Nha Ke Bang caves, Hoi An Ancient Street and Cham Islands. However, it is the bits and bites of the non-heritage site that will surprise you further. Da Lat, for example, is too picturesque to miss. French style villas is next to pine forests, bordered by strawberry garden. You will feel like Europe but the market scenes speak otherwise. Keo pagoda in Thai Binh province also exemplifies well the no-name beauty of Vietnam: feel the serenity of a religious place, situated amidst greeneries of paddy farms. Furthermore, for summer, we could not miss Nha Trang beach with is magnificient and charming beauty  and is the most worth to live City of Vietnam. Whether a must-see site or an off-the-beaten-path attraction, you will not be disappointed.
2. Drinking coffee

Coffee is the thing that lures a lot of tourists worldwide. There is the French drip coffee that can be found in every single street of Hanoi and Ho Chi Minh City. Enjoying a cup of black coffee or iced coffee with condensed milk will take you relax and you can surprisingly realize that why tobe  rush in a country like Vietnam. Interestingly, sitting outside the coffee shop to watch life going on - you will never forget Vietnam.
3. Eat exquisite cuisines

Many tourists choose Vietnam or Vietnam in their list of must-to-do country because of the variety of Vietnamese foods. Pho Hung on Spadina- Toronto, Nam Son near Bowery- New York, Le Lotus Blanc on Bourgogne of Paris- They can never be as authentic as the food served in Vietnam. Vietnamese food is very famous for pho and spring rolls and various by regions: fresh vegetables continue to dominate the tables, while meat and poultry are rising in popularity. Bun cha is the food that everyone must try as the quotation of of Anthony Bourdain: Not only did President Barack Obama sample some of Vietnam's finest local eats while in Hanoi this week, but his guide was none other than CNN "Parts Unknown".
Banh mi- thing to do when visiting Vietnam.
4. Experience traditional festivals

Thanks to its long history, rich tradition and Buddhist influence, Vietnam has festivals organized all years, especially during the Tet holiday, which is an ideal time to see how families celebrate their love for their ancestors and for each other. In the countryside, people stay over night and make Chung cake- over a bit of fire and some end-of-year gossips. In Hai Phong, the buffalo fighting festival is a well-known occasion: the winning buffalo will get killed and presented to the village god. Even public holidays in Vietnam are worth joining: come to Vietnam on the 2nd of September and you will see nation-wide parades. At that time, the whole streets is colourful with the red flags and fireworks taking over the sky at night.
Reasons for visiting Vietnam due to getting fast and easy immigration process

Besides getting Vietnam visa at Vietnam Embassy/Consulate, Vietnam visas can also be granted upon arrival. All you need to do is to apply online for your approval letter at vietnamvisavoa.com. The visa letter will be emailed to you after 2 working days . With getting Vietnam visa on arrival, applying for a visa to Vietnam seems easier when the process has been made easier and cheaper..
Let's apply for Vietnam visa on arrival online!
For further information about things to do when visiting Vietnam, please contact vietnamvisavoa.com via support@vietnamvisavoa.com  or hotline: +84 941279289

Let's enjoy Vietnamese cuisine! If you hear someone say that the reason for them to choose Vietnam as their destination is due to Vietnamese cuisine. Don’t be so surprised because this article  will convince you.
Vietnamese cuisine is so famous and the reason to make the unique and delicious dishes is the combination of Vietnamese fresh ingredients and the skillful and sophisticated taste of chef.

Vietnamese cuisine encompasses the beverages and foods of Vietnam and shows the combination of 5 fundamental taste elements. With the same dish, however, the way to make it is different from each regions: the North, the Central and the South. Every region has a sharp, specific taste characteristic based on the characteristics of geography, culture, ethnicity and climate. As a result, this contributes to the richness, diversity of Vietnam culinary.

Vietnamese dishes focus strictly on mixing spices subtly to get wonderful taste, or using the tough, brittle materials although they are totally not good for health. Vietnam cuisine features the harmony of ingredients mixing so that the dishes are not too spicy, too sweet, or too fatty.

Vietnamese people rarely eat each dish alone or in order. They always enjoy all of the dishes on the table from start to finish. Besides that, each region still has its own identity. Here is the different cuisine among regions that each tourist should know when travelling in any places of these regions.
1. Vietnamese cuisine in the North

Northern cuisine is often not spicy, fatty and sweet compared to other regions. It mainly uses diluted fish sauce and shrimp paste. Northern people use more vegetable dishes and fresh seafood such as shrimp, crabs, fish, clams, mussels etc. Many tourists are interested in Hanoi cuisine, with some famous dishes such as Pho (Vietnamese rice noodle), Bun thang (vermicelli and chicken soup), Bun cha (noodles and grilled meat) and Banh cuon (steamed rolled rice pancake). They are also the best traditional Vietnamese food that visitors should try at least once when coming to the North of Vietnam.
2. Vietnamese cuisine in the Central

Central food with all its unique characteristics reflected in distinct flavor, with more spicy and salty dishes than the Northern cuisine and the Southern cuisine. The dishes’ colors are blended brilliantly, especially with natural red and brown colors. With the geographical feature of this region, Hue, Da Nang etc are famous for sour shrimp sauce and many other types of shrimp sauce. Coming here to enjoy all the cheap and delicious seafood is a not –to- missed thing for those are addicted to seafood. Hue cuisine was mostly affected by Hue royal cuisine, so it requires high level of food processing and decorating technique. Royal cuisine in the past required a large amount of materials, so every kind of material are processed diversely, resulted in many different dishes.
3. Vietnamese cuisine in the South

Southern cuisine uses a little bit more sugar and coconut water and coconut milk. It is much influenced by the culinary of Chinese, Cambodia and Thailand. This cuisine has numerous types of dried fish and contains more saltwater and brackish water seafood than the North. It is very special with rustic dishes, which is the typical of the land opening process in the past. Nowadays, there are so many dishes with their weird names becoming specialties: voles steamed with coconut water, steamed flying fox with soya, ground green copperhead porridge, grilled snakehead etc.

Source: Vina Food
Top 10 destinations in Vietnam

A S-shaped letter country with long coastline squeezed between the South China Sea, the Laos and the Cambodia border is a land of striking landscape  from the North with the lush rice terraces and forested mountain to the picturesque valleys of the Central Highlands and the fertile delta and beautiful beaches of the South. Here is the list of top 10 destinations in Vietnam.
1. Ha Long Bay

Ha Long Bay was recognized as the World Heritage by the UNESCO. It is the top tourist destination in Vietnam. It is situated in North Vietnam for around 120 kilometer long coast line and is literally translated as “Bay of Descending Dragons”. Ha Long Bay features thousands of islands including the legendary rock ”The Kissing Rocks”(Hon Trong Mai) and spectacular seascape of limestone pillars.
2. Hoi An

Hoi An is another wonderful UNESCO World Heritage site and has been an international port since the 16th century. It is known as the Venice of Vietnam with picturesque town and narrow canals. It is famous for its specialties, excellent tailors, interesting art galleries and narrow streets with full of cafe shops and local street food.
3.  Ha Noi

Hanoi is the capital of Vietnam, which is a great place to walk around and experience the life of people living here. Must-to-do places for visiting are the Temple of Literature, the Mausoleum of Ho Chi Minh, the Ethnology Museum and The Old Quarter with its 36 old streets. It keeps the tradition with lifestyle and especially the preservation of old French colonial architecture.
4. Sapa

Sapa is located in the northwest region of Vietnam. It is a wonderful place for an authentic rural experience. This stunningly beautiful area with lush green valleys are offen shrouded in mist and is home to hill tribes such as the Hmong, the Tay and the Muong. It’s is the great area for taking short treks to neighbouring villages, visiting local markets in a very cool atmostphere. Rice terraces can be found in the Muong Hoa valley between Sa Pa town and the Fansipan mountain, on a backdrop of thick bamboo woodlands.
5. Hue

Hue is the former imperial capital of Vietnam. Its mesmersizing tombs and mausoleums of the last emperors reveal fascinating insights into the lives of the imperial families and their subjects. The Thien Mu pagoda in Hue is the tallest pagoda in Vietnam that overlooks the Perfume River and is regarded as the unofficial symbol of the former imperial capital.
6. Mekong Delta

Located in the southernmost region of the country, the Mekong Delta is Vietnam’s ricebasket which produces about half of the country’s rice. Tourists can enjoy floating markets such as Cai be and Cai Rang in a great boat trip down the river. Along the way you can see local traders and rice farmers working.
7. Phu Quoc

Located in front of the Cambodia coast, Phu Quoc is the largest island in Vietnam. The island features pristine tropical forests, undamaged coral reefs and great beaches. One of its famous beaches. Bai Dai (Long Beach) was chosen by the ABC news as one of the live beautiful and clean beaches. It is famous for producing the best fermented fish sauce (nuoc mam) in the world.
8. Nha Trang

Nha Trang is Vietnam’s most popular seaside resort town located along the second most beautiful bays. It features beautiful beaches with fine and clean sand and clear ocean water with mild temperatures.
9. Ho Chi Minh city

Ho Chi Minh city is the largest city in Vietnam and has more than enough interesting things to see and places to visit. It is famous for its blend of historic and modern attractions to vibrant shopping, dining and nightlife. It was formerly known as Saigon and served as the capital of South Vietnam during the Vietnam War. It is the largest city of Vietnam.
10. Da Lat

Da Lat was used by Vietnamese emperors and French colonials as a summer retreat.With year-round cool weather and idyllic scenery of misty valleys, lush pine trees and colorful flowers are some of the reasons that Da Lat, a charming town in the South Central Highlands of Vietnam is a popular destination for those looking for relief from the heat.

column1: 9449,"[:en]10 top tourist attractions in Hanoi[:]","[:en]

column2: Hanoi is the capital of Vietnam with so many hightlights that tourists are lured by its own natural beauty with normal life of Hanoian. Here are the top otourist attractions in Hanoi.
1. Hoan Kiem Lake

Hoan Kiem Lake or the lake of returned sword marks the historical center of ancient Hanoi. It is attractive to tourists by its legend and the Ngoc Son temple in the middle of the Jade Island leading through the red-painted Morning Sunlight Bridge. Nowadays, it is the first place that every tourists should come first when coming to Hanoi.
2. Hanoi’s Old Quarter

The Old Quarter is the combination of the old and new as ancient narrow streets snake between old brick buildings. There are many motorbikes and street vendors walking along Hanoi streets, selling fresh fruits  and gifts of Hanoi. Walking along streets here to enjoy Hanoi streetfood and experience the lifestyle of people living here.  At weekends, tourists have chance to enjoy the night market,  see some walking streets with entertainments and beverages of Hanoi. Especially, sitting in the beer corner, drinking “Bia hoi” and watching people around you are some of interesting activities for most tourists here.
3. Temple of Literature

Temple of Literature is the holy place for education. This is also the temple of Confucius and is the first national university of Vietnam built in the 11th  century. This is also the symbol of Hanoi with very special pavilion and 82 Stelae of Doctor.
4. Vietnam Museum of Ethnology

Vietnam is actually a coagulation of 54 different ethnic groups. The Museum of Ethnology strives to give a better understanding of each region with their own custom and religious belief. It is widely believed to be the best of all the modern museums in Vietnam. Displays include a combination of art, everyday objects, and historic artifacts to better tell the story of each unique culture for both indoor and outdoor exhibition.
5. Hoa Lo prison

The Hoa Lo Prison or the Maison Central was originally built by the French to house Vietnamese political prisoners in 1896. This prison detained both Vietnamese political and economic prisioners. After 1954, the North Vietnamese Army later used the prison to house for American pilots. Well known figures such as Senator John McCain, James Stockdale and Bud Day were just a few of the many prisoners of war that spent time in this prison. Two thirds of the prison was torn down to make way for the Hanoi Towers; the rest was turned into a museum and is now a popular tourist attraction in Hanoi.
6. Ho Chi Minh Presidential Palace

The Presidential palace was built for the French Governor of the Indochina colony in the early 1900’s. After 1954, the government of Vietnam took over this place and asked the President Ho Chi Minh to live there but Ho Chi Minh refused to live there as it was so luxurious. Nowadays, it is the place for high-ranking level meeting of the government. The house is designed in a well-tended garden  with the impressive colour of its outside architecture.
7. Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum

It is the final resting place of Vietnamese communist leader Ho Chi Minh in Ba Dinh Square, where he read the nation’s declaration of independence in 1945. It is opened to public for free every morning except for Monday and Friday. Every a lot of Vietnamese people and tourists come and queue for a long time to see his body.
8. Thang Long Water Puppet Theater

This theater celebrates a peasant art form that began in the rice paddies over a thousand years ago. Puppets were simply carved and puppeteers would stand on the surface of water in a paddies field. Traditional Vietnamese instruments perform an opera that narrates the puppets ‘actions. Musicians will interact with puppets showing funny stories of Vietnamese farmer’s life  and their entertainment activities.
9. West lake

West Lake is the biggest fresh water lake in Hanoi. It is the place that has the high-end homes of Hanoi’s wealthy live and contains a large number of hotels, restaurants and luxury shops as well. It has been a popular location for residents here for thousands of years. It is also the  place  of the oldest pagoda of Hanoi, which was built in the 6th century.
10. One Pillar Pagoda

This eleventh century temple was built by the emperor in gratitude for finally being blessed by a son. The temple was meant to look like a lotus flower blossoming from a single pillar in the pond, similar to the prophetic dream of the king.
Source: Touropia

column1: 9467,"[:en]Vietnam visa on arrival and Vietnam Embassy visa, which one to choose?[:]","[:en]

column2: Have you ever considered about Vietnam visa on arrival and Vietnam Embassy visa? What is the difference between these two types of visas? Which one should you choose? Here are the answers.
1. Vietnam embassy visa

This visa is stamped on your passport at Vietnam Embassy/Consulate and it is required to have original passport and other paperworks within 5-7 working days for visa processing. Fees and extra fees vary in different places. And this visa type is applied for all cases, whether you travel by land, by air or by sea to Vietnam.
2. Vietnam visa on arrival

This visa can be applied online through a travel agent or visa agent to get a visa approval letter which allows applicants to fly to Vietnam and have a visa stamped on passport when arriving at Vietnam international airports.
The visa procedure is simpler and faster within 02 working days or even within hours with no required papers except the passport copy.
3. Which one to choose?
Getting Vietnam visa on arrival is recommended for:

It is for those living far away from Vietnam Embassy/Consulate but remember that this visa type is applied when you travel to Vietnam by air only. This is a great way for those who want to save time and money without visiting an Embassy. Especially, it is highly recommended for urgent cases which you can not manage time to go to Vietnam Embassy. For many people, who must travel alot, they might forget to apply for Vietnam visa or do not notice that the visa is already expired, in such cases, Vietnam visa on arrival is the utmost helpful.

column1: 9471,"[:en]Vietnam Visa tips: All you need to know[:]","[:en]

column2: All Vietnam visa tips for every traveller to Vietnam are listed below. Dont miss or you will loose!

1. For visa on arrival, there should be no problem for arriving the country 1 day earlier with date provided and leave 1 day later after the visa expires. However, you can only do it with your airline's permission.

2. Small typo mistake on the visa or approval letter like a misspelling with your name is accepted, however, it is strongly recommended that you check your details carefully to make sure that they are correct to avoid any unexpected issues  at airports.

3. Visa regulations are often changing, so check carefully before you are due to travel. Usually, it is possible to extend visas within Vietnam but not during the Party Congresses and extension fee costs you a lot more.
4. Visa extensions are often done with less than 1 week on your ongoing visa and the regulation just change dramatically.

5. In case, you are exempted from visa to Vietnam, and want to stay longer than your allowed time, the fee is quite  more expensive, so keep in mind this when you plan your travel itinerary. In this case, you should get a visa for 1 month or 3 months upon arrival.
6. Please apply for a visa to Vietnam one or two weeks in advance to avoid unwanted troubles or extra fee for urgent service.

7. Tourist visas give holders the permission to enter and exit Vietnam at airports in Hanoi, Ho Chi Minh and Danang city or through any of twelve border gates of Vietnam, three of which are with Cambodia and China, and six with Laos.

8. The privilege of visiting Vietnam without the possession of Vietnam Visa is only granted to residents of several nations. - Most citizens of ASEAN countries do not need Vietnam entry visa to visit Vietnam within 30 days. - Citizens of Japan, Korea & Scandinavians (Denmark, Sweden, Norway and Finland passport owners) do not need visa to Vietnam to enter Vietnam within 15 days. - Citizens of other nationalities are obliged to get Vietnam Visa before departuring (Vietnam entry visa issued by Vietnamese embassies or consulates in advance of departure ) or pre-approved Vietnam Visa (visa issued on arrival at Vietnam International Airports) supplied before arriving in Vietnam.
9. Tourist visas are applicable to 1 month or 3 months only In case you want to stay longer, you will need to apply for business visa and we could get both types of visa for you.

10.  You can obtain a visa on arrival with a Vietnamese travel agent. You will need to provide details of your passport beforehand and they will confirm with you the issuance of your visa at the arriving airport.

11. If you plan to spend more than a month in Vietnam and you want to leave for neighbor countries like Laos, Cambodia, you will need to have a three-month multiple-Visa. In Cambodia, the fee is about US$95 but this is not available in all Vietnamese embassies.

12. Personal appearance can affect how you receive reception from the airport immigration. From our experiences, if you dress in shabby clothing or shorts, look filthy or bristly, you may anticipate troubles.

column1: 9485,"[:en]8 best foods in Hanoi [:]","[:en]<h2 style=""text-align: justify;"">

column2: Are you visiting Hanoi ? Here is the list of best foods in Hanoi that every tourist coud not miss when visiting this city.
1. Phở

One of the best foods in Hanoi, Phở is very well-enjoyed by all locals since it was “invented” in the early 20th century. Phở or rice noodle soup-is omnipresent in Hanoi, from street vendors to high-end restaurant chains. Phở is served with chicken or with beef. Each type of meat entails a variety of sub-dish, from beef tenderloin to beef brisket, chicken wing to chicken thigh.

Pho Bo is arguably the most well-known of all Vietnamese soups. It was inspired by French settlers who commonly ate beef, where Vietnamese traditionally preferred pork, chicken, and fish. Pho Bo has become the favorite dish that can be enjoyed whenever people feel hungry, especially popularly eaten  for breakfast and dinner in Hanoi and throughout Vietnam.
2. Bún chả

Another famous thing in the list of best foods in Hanoi could not miss Bún Chả. Just walking around Hanoi in the lunchtime, you will feel the air perfumed with the scent of sizzling grilled pork, the key component to the city’s signature dish. The grilled pork is served with a sweet and salty broth, slices of green papaya, rice noodles and fresh herbs.
3. Bánh cuốn

If the French has famous delicious crepe made of wheat, egg and dairy products, Vietnamese and particularly Hanoian is proud of steamed crepe from rice flour and water. A pancake contains ground pork, wood-ear and seasoning. Banh cuon is served with a mixture of fish sauce, sugar and lime (nước mắm).
Bánh cuốn is one of Hanoi’s favorite breakfast items and is into any list of must-try Vietnamese dishes.
4. Bánh mì

The baguette is one of the symbols of French colonialism. It’s given a Southeast Asian twist by stuffing it with pâté, mayonnaise, pickled carrots and daikon, jalapeños and gobs of cold cuts. But the bánh mì is basically a blank slate to which cooks can add whatever they desire. They could be with fried egg, fresh carrot, cucumber, green papaya and corianders mixed with chili sauce.
5. Xôi

The glutinous rice is topped with lotus root or boiled peanut with green beans, or with Chinese sausage, stewed pork or chicken etc. You can seek out the street vendors with giant baskets stuffed with warm sticky rice in the morning.
6. Chả cá
Chunks of fried fish is served with plenty of turmeric, then sizzled with heaps of dill to enjoy with rice noodles. It’s a fragrant delight that could not be missed.
7. Bia Hơi

Bia hơi is a special type of homemade beer, unpreserved, brewed daily and delivered in kegs to local businesses in Hanoi. Unlike canned or bottled beer, Bia hoi should be consumed the day after it leaves the factory. It’s brand-less and very cheap compared to Western-style beers. Tourists can drink as much beer as possible because its light flavour.
8. Bánh Tôm

Bánh Tôm is another Vietnamese dish originated from Hanoi. It’s made of battered and deep-fried sweet potato and shrimp. Bánh Tôm is commonly wrapped with lettuce, herbs, and pickled vegetables. It is often served as an appetizer or snacks.
Let's apply for Vietnam visa on arrival now to visit Ha Noi and enjoy our ymmy foods!

There are many tourist attractions in Nha Trang which are becoming increasingly popular in recent years because of its pristine beach, best scuba diving center of Vietnam as well as lots of interesting places and delicious food to enjoy.

Nha Trang is a seaside town that is the most popular beach destination of Vietnam. Tourists are welcome to participate in the Sea Festival, held biennially. Nha Trang is located on the South central coast of Vietnam, just over 400 kilometers Northeast of Ho Chi Minh city. Nha Trang bay covers the area of 405 Km2 including 19 large and small islands. If you see from high above, the bay looks like the aquamarine stone sparkling in the sunshine, bounded by miles of smoothy golden sands.
What to do in Nha Trang

Many tourists come to Nha Trang to enjoy the heavenly beaches, the hot springs, diversified kinds of fish and colourful coral reef underwater. It is advisable to come to Nha Trang form January to August, people will have chance to experience the most wonderful weather for swimming and sunbathing.

Nha Trang offers the picturesque vista of primary forest, waterfall and high mountain peak. Hon Ba Peak is regarded as “the second Da Lat of Vietnam”. Tourists also can visit Long Son pagoda, Po Nagar Cham Towers, National Oceangraphic Museum of Vietnam and Nha Trang Live and especially Vinpearl Land.

Hon Tam resort is the harmonious combination of modern restaurants, swimming pools with wild beaches and tropical forest. Tri Nguyen Aquarium, with the design of a go-aground ship is also worth visiting.
Nha Trang Live

This helps tourists to know the city from accommodation to the economy. Every piece of information is provided by local residents and business professionals. You can get cold drinks and coffee with free wireless Internet here.

Oceanographic Museum of Vietnam is an interesting aquarium where tourists can gain the exact image of Nha Trang marine environment. Nowhere can people expect to see a more extensive collections of living things from the Eastern Sea like in this museum.
Po Nagar Cham Towers

It is a complex of temples erected before about 781A.D. It is the place that tourists can find hundreds of ancient relics displayed inside the complex. This place belonged to the medieval principality of Khauthara, a small country near modern Nha Trang. The four Po Nagar Towers today are truly beautiful and charming. Each of them was built to delicate to a unique deity.
Vinpearl Land

One of tourist attractions in Nha Trang, Vinpearl Land lures most tourists every year. It is an international five star hotel in the Vinpearl Nha Trang of hotel, tourism, resort and entertainment that is considered as “a twinkling pearl glued on the crown of the Sea queen”. It is located on one of the world’s most famous bays. Everyone is impressed by monuments and famous spots and this five star hotel on island with 485 stunning architectural rooms including 29 luxury room, one presidential room and one royal room. Vinpearl Land complex is designed to be an independence recreational spot and is built in an island including the five-star international resort system Vinpearl Resort Nha Trang and Vinpearl Amusement Park, Mall and Food Village. Vinpearl Land used to host many international beauty competitions such as Miss Universe of Miss Earth. Vinpearl also has a freshwater pool, which is the largest one in Southeast Asia with more than 5700m2 areas for sunbathing and traveling.
What to eat in Nha Trang

Tourists will be amazed at its delicacies, mostly from various kinds of seafood with it best flavor fish sauce in Vietnam. Among many specialities, grilled fermented pork roll, grilled beef, rice vermicelli with grilled fish and jellyfish, fresh seafood are most favorite.

Ha Giang is such a famous destination for a lot of adventurous travellers as there are so many tourist attractions in this wonderful land.

Ha Giang is a province in Northeastern Vietnam and is known as Vietnam’s final frontier. It has mountainous topography with the least potential for agricultural development. The province borders China with a length of over 270 kilometers. Ha Giang has very cool climate in summer and extremely cold in winter when snow can be seen here. The temperature in Ha Giang ranges from 5-28 Celcius degree, which is pretty ideal for tourism.

Ha Giang province consists of mainly ethnic minorities with a major of Hmong, Tay, Dao and Nung ethnic groups. Each ethnic group has its unique custom in term of wedding, worship, festivals or funeral.

Khau Vai Love Market is a unique spot which is held monthly only on the 26th and 27th followed Chinese calendar. According to the legend, the love story between the boy of the H’mong and the girl of the Giay led to the grudge between two tribes. They were forced to stay away from each other. However, to avoid a bloody confrontation, the vowed that they would meet each other once on the March 26th at Khau Vai Market. Nowadays, Khau Vai love market has become the dating fair, finding love from young to married people.

Lunar New Year is the best time to visit Ha Giang when tourists can see a wide variety of traditional customs of ethnic minorities here such as: celebrating success, rain ritual, crossbow shooting competition or “Con” throwing competition.

It has impressive limestone and granite peaks and outcrops. It attracts tourists because of its grandiose mountains. It stands out for extensive area of limestone with unique formation of peaky rocks. Especially, Dong Van Rock Plateau is recognized by the UNESCO as one of 77 geological parks in the world. Lung Cu Flag Tower lures a lot of adventurous climbers to challenge themselves. Ha giang is only a venue of fanciful natural caves such as Fairy cave and Swallow cave.

Tourists can visit Dong Van upland, one of famous tourist attractions in Ha Giang which has the Lung Cu flag pole- the roof of Vietnam. Tourists  will have the opportunity to enjoy fresh air, learn more about traditional culture of a unique ethnic.  Besides, Ha Giang is famous for variety of delicious fruits such as: peaches, plums, pears, apples and precious medicial plants such as : ventricles, salmon, cinnamon etc. This place inspires artists to create unique painting about mountains, rice terraces etc.

Quan Ba Twin mountain is a beautiful symbol of the Dong Van highland, which is the crystalline beauty of nature and tectonic. The mountain is recognized as the national scenic spot. Tourists cannot help admiring  the spectacular beauty of the mountains, the unique gift which heaven blesses for Ha Giang.

Ma Pi Leng pass is the most dangerous pass in the northern border mountain area and is considered as the king of the Vietnam’s pass or Great Wall of Vietnam or the Pyramid of the Meo. At the top of Ma Pi Leng mount, it is the happiness road with a stone stela recording the marks in the construction process. Its scenery is unique with majestic and wild beauty.

Nho Que River is also an attractive destination for tourists. It is located on Ma Pi Leng mountain and is regarded as the mysterious of nature. Tourists can comtemplate a river like a silky fillet looming in fog which brings tourists a pleasant sensation of a naturally romantic masterpiece.

column1: 9532,"[:en]Things to do in Ha Long Bay[:]","[:en]

column2: Ha Long Bay is increasingly popular for tourists with its spectacular seascape of limestone pillars. With its unspoiled islands, Ha Long Bay has outstanding scenic beauty that leaves deep imprints on every tourist's mind whenever coming to this special land.
Some of the most popular activities in Ha Long Bay are swimming, fishing, snorkeling and kayaking, trekking and cycling. It is truly a paradise for every visitor.

Ha Long Bay or the Bay of the Descending Dragon is located in the Gulf of Tonkin belonging to Quang Ninh Province, in the northeast of Vietnam, and is about 165 km from the capital of Ha Noi. Covering an area of 43,400 ha and including over 1600 islands and islets, most of which are uninhabitated and unaffected by humans, it is an ideal model of a mature Karst landscape developed during a warm and wet tropical climate.

It is recognized by the UNESCO World Heritage and represents the pinnacle of tourists’ experience in Vietnam. It is both mystical and magnificent, incredible feat of nature that almost never fails to impress.
Most tourists are interested in boat cruise around spectacular Ha Long Bay with its iconic limestone peaks and emerald green waters and experience a lot of interesting activities.

Tourists can experience Tai Chi , which has been practiced for generations in China to promote the health of mind, body and soul. Practicing Tai Chi in the peace and tranquility of the great outdoors aids in the deep concentration  and inner peace can be founded by the sublime beauty of Halong Bay in the early mornings.

Visiting a traditional floating village to imagine the living day to day life surrounded by the incredible beauty of this famous bay. Tourists can visit charming villages, meet grinning fishermen and playful children to enjoy their fascinating way of life in Ha Long Bay.

Dicsovering hidden caves and grottoes such as Thien Cung cave, Dau Go cave are activities that are considered most beautiful primitive cave of the Bay. Tourist would be surprised by a large space inside the cave that the further you walk, the more beautiful formation of stalactites come to your eyes.
